text: Johann Kaps (25 September 1895 - 7 April 1966 ) was an Austrian football player . He played for Wiener AC and was part of the team which won the first title for WAC. He also was a politician. In 1934 Kaps was arrested for political activity for the Social Democrats. He was interned in the WÃ¶llersdorf detention camp Das Rote Wien (German) for several months, where his teeth were also broken. From 1945 to 1964 he was member of the Vienna City Council.Das Rote Wien (German) ==References== Category:1895 births Category:1966 deaths Category:Association football forwards Category:Austrian footballers Category:Austrian football forwards
